project_name: FIP Editors - Filecoin Improvement Proposal Governance
description:
Throughout the RetroPGF Round 3 period, the FIP Editors group maintained the open governance process that enables protocol change in Filecoin.  
Editors reviewed, formatted, and stewarded proposals including [FIP-0100](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0100.md), [FIP-0105](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0105.md), [FIP-0106](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0106.md), [FIP-0109](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0109.md), and [FIP-0077](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0077.md), ensuring clarity, completeness, and alignment across implementers. 

FIP Editors triaged and merged dozens of PRs, improved editorial standards, and coordinated with authors and the Implementers WG during NV25–NV27 upgrades.  

By keeping the proposal pipeline transparent and consistent, the Editors upheld neutral, community-driven protocol governance.
additional_impact:
The Editors strengthened Filecoin’s open governance model by maintaining a transparent and consistent proposal pipeline.  

They updated editorial guidelines, clarified status transitions, and improved issue labelling and tracking in the repository.  

These efforts help new contributors navigate the FIPs process and ensure the long-term sustainability of Filecoin protocol governance.
end_user:
All Filecoin protocol contributors - client teams, researchers, service providers, and builders - benefit from the FIP Editors’ work.  

By ensuring every FIP is accurate, reviewable, and properly recorded, the Editors provide the foundation for predictable upgrades and transparent decision-making.  

Developers gain clear specifications to implement, while the community gains confidence that protocol changes are evaluated through an open and consistent process.
testimonials:
Positive feedback appears regularly in FIP PR threads, Implementers WG calls, and community discussions, highlighting the Editors’ responsiveness and clarity in guiding proposals through review and merge.  

Contributors praise the Editors’ neutrality and attention to detail that reduce friction for proposal authors.  

Examples are visible in merged PR comment threads within the [FIPs repository](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs).
governance_accessibility_impact:
The **FIP Editors** have made Filecoin governance more accessible by maintaining an open, transparent, and well-documented proposal process.  

All discussions, drafts, and reviews take place publicly in the [FIPs repository](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs), allowing anyone to propose, comment on, or follow protocol changes in real time.

By improving editorial guidelines, clarifying FIP status transitions, and maintaining consistent labeling and tracking, the Editors have lowered the barrier for new contributors to participate.  

These efforts ensure that protocol governance is understandable, inclusive, and discoverable to a broader set of Filecoin community members.
